QuestionJSON.Question: Robin is designing a basketball statistics tracking application. They want to include the most relevant stats in the app to make it useful for the users. Which process or method best describes how Robin should design their program?
QuestionJSON.Answer1: Decide the features of the application only based on personal preferences
QuestionJSON.Answer2: Determine the features of the app by picking random basketball stats
QuestionJSON.Answer3: Work with prospective users to understand what statistics are most useful to them, design a first version, get user feedback, and continue to revise
QuestionJSON.Answer4: Design the app with the most complicated statistics to make it more professional
QuestionJSON.Explanation: A successful application is designed by involving user preferences and feedback. This iterative process, where the creator works closely with users and constantly revises the product based on their feedback, is a common practice in the development of successful applications.
